intro: Struthanthus bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored grass-veldt flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive two-toned flowers, which typically range from white to pink. The plant produces small, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to arid conditions. Struthanthus bicolor is known for its short blooming period, usually during the summer months.
